column1: In 1882 the California Southern Railroad built a line from Perris to Elsinore along the east side of the San Jacinto River. The Santa Fe Railroad bought the line and joined it with their line in San Bernardino. Floods in 1884
column4: and the Santa Fe Railroad decided to abandon the line. Soon after the last flood the Temescal Water Company bought the railroad right-of-way
column8: and other land from B.T. Kuert. Those were the two parcels that make up most of Canyon Lake today.Construction started in 1927 to build a dam across the river to store water. It was finished in 1929. Railroad Canyon Reservoir
column10: was one of the largest fresh water lakes for fishing
column11: hunting and camping in Southern California. The reservoir and the surrounding area was leased as a concession from Temescal Water Company as a recreational area under the operation of the George D. Evans family from 1937 until after World War II. After the war Ray and Alpha Schekel
column12: along with John and Darleen Kirkland
column13: operated the resort until 1949 when the lake was drained for repairs to the floodgates. Elinor and Donald Martin operated the resort from its reopening in 1953 until 1968.In 1968 the Corona Land Development Company developed the new community.Canyon Lake began as a master-planned community developed by Corona Land Company in 1968

column1: The city of Canyon Lake is located east of Lake Elsinore and Interstate 15
column2: in the southern foothills of the Temescal Mountains. The mountain range is on the western edge of the Perris Block and east of the Elsinore Fault Zone.

column1: The community is named for Canyon Lake reservoir

column11: which provides approximately 10% of the domestic water supply in the Lake Elsinore/Canyon Lake area.

column1: There are three business or shopping areas within the City of Canyon Lake. Towne Center is located at the west end of the city on Railroad Canyon Road across from the main gate. Another is located at the east gate of the city on Goetz Road. The main shopping and business center of the city
column2: Canyon Lake Towne Center
column3: is located directly across Railroad Canyon Road from the Main (south) entrance gates. It provides Canyon Lake with many services
column4: and is the location of Canyon Lake City Hall
column7: and the Property Owner's Association offices
column8: which are all located side by side in the same building. Another building in the Towne Center mall houses the Canyon Lake Chamber of Commerce.

column1: The City of Canyon Lake was incorporated on December 1
column2: 1990.  The elected body of government is the five member city council that is elected at large by the voters of the city.

column1: Canyon Lake is a largely Republican city. Since its date of incorporation
column2: all eight Republican gubernatorial
column4: and all nine senate candidates who qualified for the general election ballot carried the city by a margin of at least 23 points
column6: as well as  George W. Bush in 2000
column7: and 2004 each carrying the city by a margin of over 50 points. Canyon Lake is also one of the few cities in California where Donald Trump received a greater percentage of the vote in 2016 than Mitt Romney did in 2012.

column1: All gates are manned twenty-four hours a day by a community patrol contracted by US Security Associates. Access is granted to outsiders by sponsorship from a property owner or renter who calls in their guests to a 24-hour answer line. Since becoming an incorporated city in 1990
column2: Canyon Lake has its own police department (through a contract with the Riverside County Sheriff's Department
column3: out of the Lake Elsinore Station)
column4: as well as the private security services. In recent years specialized "code enforcement" officers have also maintained patrols of the approximately 20-acre (8.1 ha) parcel of land administered by the Bureau of Land Management which encompasses the eastern shore of the lake in its upper reaches. The trail running north along the eastern shore of the lake has become an inviting activity for hikers and birdwatchers
column5: particularly in the winter months when the hills are green and temperatures lower. Canyon Lake forbids all public use of any "two-wheeled motorized vehicle" (that is
column8: and dirt bikes) on all private streets throughout the CLPOA
column9: but excluding the two public roads (Railroad Canyon and Goetz Roads).The Canyon Lake Property Owners Association contracts with US Security Associates for community patrol. The patrol enforces community rules and regulations (CC&Rs) which includes noise ordinances
column11: and community access. The Marine Patrol division enforces lake
column13: beach & fishing rules and regulations. All California fishing laws are enforced.

column1: The city of Canyon Lake Fire Department contracts for fire and paramedic service with the Riverside County Fire Department. Fire Station 60 is the only fire station and is staffed with three firefighters
column2: including one firefighter/paramedic. Ambulance transport services are provided to the city by American Medical Response (AMR). AMR has a storefront in Town Center.
the community was the subject of United Gates of America
column3: a BBC television documentary directed by Alex Cooke
column4: featuring journalist Charlie LeDuff. He lived for a month within the community
column5: to explore why people wanted to lock themselves behind gates and fences
column6: and what effect it had on the residents. LeDuff also explored the issues of immigration from Mexico and Central America
column7: and highlighted the issues of segregation and racism that exist in the United States. The film was the subject of some controversy within the community
column8: but received positive reviews in the UK and other parts of the US.

column1: The community is served directly by the Canyon Lake Community Church

column3: but located outside the gated portion of the community. The Tides Church has facilities in the Canyon Lake Towne Center.
